block.p: LEAD: Schubert's ''Rosamunde'' Overture, the Beethoven Violin Concerto and excerpts from Wagner's ''Gotterdammerung'' form the program for the benefit concert that opens the New York Philharmonic season, on Sept. 14 at 7:30 P.M. at Avery Fisher Hall. Zubin Mehta is to conduct, with Isaac Stern as the soloist in the Beethoven.

LEAD: Schubert's ''Rosamunde'' Overture, the Beethoven Violin Concerto and excerpts from Wagner's ''Gotterdammerung'' form the program for the benefit concert that opens the New York Philharmonic season, on Sept. 14 at 7:30 P.M. at Avery Fisher Hall. Zubin Mehta is to conduct, with Isaac Stern as the soloist in the Beethoven.

Schubert's ''Rosamunde'' Overture, the Beethoven Violin Concerto and excerpts from Wagner's ''Gotterdammerung'' form the program for the benefit concert that opens the New York Philharmonic season, on Sept. 14 at 7:30 P.M. at Avery Fisher Hall. Zubin Mehta is to conduct, with Isaac Stern as the soloist in the Beethoven. Tickets for the black-tie event are $125 (preconcert cocktails are included), $300 and $500 (dinner is included in both prices) and - for a box of eight seats -$6,000 (preconcert reception, intermission cocktails and dinner for eight included). Information: 874-2424.
